com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring

Class BackgroundManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.leantegra.powermote.sdk.monitoring.BackgroundManager

  • public class BackgroundManager
extends Object
    Allows to monitor regions when an application is in the background mode.

    Note: The BackgroundManager class registers an internal MonitoringListener with the MonitoringManager. If you use the BackgroundManager, your application must not manually register a second MonitoringListener.

    Usage: 
      public class MyApplication extends Application implements BackgroundManager.BackgroundScanListener{
      private BackgroundManager mBackgroundManager;

      @Override
      public void onCreate() {
          super.onCreate();
          //Construct list of regions
          ArrayList<Region> regionArrayList = new ArrayList<>();
          regionArrayList.add(new Region.Builder(1).setUUID(UUID.fromString(POWER_MOTE_UUID)).setRadius(1f).build());
          //Set background scan period
          MonitoringManager.INSTANCE.setBackgroundScanPeriod(1000,1000);
          //Create BackgroundManager
          mBackgroundManager = new BackgroundManager(getApplicationContext(), regionArrayList, this);
          //Start background scan
          mBackgroundManager.startScan();
      }

      @Override
      public void onError(ScanError scanError) {
          //Handle error
      }

      @Override
      public void onEnterRegion(Region region, BaseFrame baseFrame) {
          ...
      }

      @Override
      public void onExitRegion(Region region, BaseFrame baseFrame) {
          ...
      }
  }
    Since:
    1.0.0
    See Also:
    MonitoringManager

      • BackgroundManager

        public BackgroundManager(Context context,
                 List<Region> regionList,
                 BackgroundManager.BackgroundScanListener backgroundScanListener)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs monitoring with the background scan in your Application from multiple regions
        Parameters:
        context - application context.
        regionList - list of Region what you want monitoring.
        backgroundScanListener - used to deliver scan events or error.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the region list is empty
        See Also:
        Region, MonitoringManager
